conclusion: Containers A, B, C, and D each have liquid flowing into them, and containers E, F, and G at the bottom will catch the liquid after it passes through baffles.
Liquid from A (yellow) travels down and splits; the baffle arrangement forces this liquid toward E.
Liquid from B (green) flows downward and splits into two possible paths, appearing to be directed toward F.
Liquid from C (blue) appears to go toward G after passing through the baffle.
Liquid from D (light green) flows similarly toward G after passing through a baffle.
The liquid from A flows into E.
The liquid from B flows into F.
The liquids from C and D both flow into G.
